intro: Helianthemum ledifolium var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockrose, is a low-growing shrub native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant has compact, evergreen foliage with narrow, leathery leaves that are gray-green in color. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. This hardy species is well adapted to harsh environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover.
